rules: Rule1: If the Team identifies pollution as a threat, then the wetlands achieve protected status.
Rule2: If the Lab confirms contamination in water samples, then the Consortium issues an alert to the Health Department.
Rule3: Either the Lab confirms contamination in water samples or the Team identifies pollution as a threat.
Rule4: If the Consortium mobilizes volunteers, then the Consortium initiates cleanup of the wetlands.
Rule5: If the Consortium secures equipment, then the Consortium mobilizes volunteers.
Rule6: If the Consortium drafts a protection plan proposal, then the Consortium submits the proposal to the Council.
Rule7: If the Consortium submits the proposal to the Council, then the Consortium influences policy at the Local Council.
Rule8: If the Council holds a hearing on the proposal, then should Developers file an injunction, Developers escalate legal action.

Rule9: If the Consortium receives test results from the Lab, then provided that it is not the case that confirming contamination in water samples leads to not issuing an alert to the Health Department, the Consortium initiates cleanup of the wetlands.
Rule10: Either the Consortium receives test results from the Lab or the Consortium reviews data with Experts.
Rule11: If the Consortium reviews data with Experts, then Experts validate findings from the data.

Rule12: If Experts validate findings from the data, then whenever confirming contamination in water samples does not lead to not issuing an alert to the Health Department, the Consortium initiates cleanup of the wetlands.
Rule13: If the Regulator audits procedures at the Lab, then should the Lab detect errors in methodology, the Lab does not confirm contamination in water samples.
Rule14: If the Consortium organizes the community, then the Consortium mobilizes volunteers.
Rule15: If the Consortium seeks private funding, then the Consortium delays the project.
Rule16: If the Team publishes findings in the Journal, then either the Team discovers rare species in the wetlands or the wetlands achieve protected status.
Rule17: If the Consortium influences policy at the Local Council, then the Team publishes findings in the Journal.
Rule18: Either the Consortium faces opposition from Developers or the Consortium influences policy at the Local Council.
Rule19: If the Consortium wins public support, then the Consortium does not face opposition from Developers.
Rule20: If it is not the case that receiving a government grant results in beginning surveying the wetlands, then the Consortium seeks private funding.
Rule21: If it is not the case that receiving a government grant triggers beginning surveying the wetlands, then the Consortium does not delay the project.
Rule22: If confirming contamination in water samples does not cause not issuing an alert to the Health Department, then the Consortium secures equipment.
Rule23: If confirming contamination in water samples does not imply not issuing an alert to the Health Department, then the Consortium does not initiate cleanup of the wetlands.
Rule24: If appealing the decision does not lead to approving the plan, then the Council delays implementation.
Rule25: If appealing the decision does not result in approving the plan, then the Council does not delay implementation.

Rule26: If it is not the case that not confirming contamination in water samples causing not issuing an alert to the Health Department leads to organizing the community, then Developers appeal the decision.
Rule27: If the Consortium does not influence policy at the Local Council, then Developers file an injunction.
Rule28: If the wetlands do not achieve protected status, then the Consortium receives a government grant.
facts: Fact1: The Consortium drafts a protection plan proposal.
Fact2: The Council holds a hearing on the proposal.
Fact3: The Lab detects errors in methodology.
Fact4: The Regulator audits procedures at the Lab.
Fact5: The Consortium wins public support.
Fact6: Developers do not escalate legal action.
Fact7: The Consortium does not begin surveying the wetlands.
Fact8: The Council does not approve the plan.
Fact9: The Team does not discover rare species in the wetlands.
